greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of same-trees of weight n.
comment: A same-tree is either: (case 1) a positive integer, or (case 2) a finite sequence of two or more same-trees all having the same weight, where the weight in case 2 is the sum of weights.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..4000
formula: a(n) = 1 + Sum a(d)^(n/d) where the sum is over divisors less than n.
program: (PARI) seq(n)={my(v=vector(n)); for(n=1, n, v[n] = 1 + sumdiv(n, d, v[n/d]^d)); v} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Aug 20 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jan 15 2017
